comment.text: Subunit of the beta-cell ATP-sensitive potassium channel (KATP). Regulator of ATP-sensitive K(+) channels and insulin release.

isoform.name: SUR1Delta2
isoform.text: Abundant isoform with prodiabetic properties, predominant in heart.

disease.name: Leucine-induced hypoglycemia
disease.description: Rare cause of hypoglycemia and is described as a condition in which symptomatic hypoglycemia is provoked by high protein feedings. Hypoglycemia is also elicited by administration of oral or intravenous infusions of a single amino acid, leucine.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Familial hyperinsulinemic hypoglycemia 1
disease.description: Most common cause of persistent hypoglycemia in infancy. Unless early and aggressive intervention is undertaken, brain damage from recurrent episodes of hypoglycemia may occur.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Diabetes mellitus, permanent neonatal
disease.description: A rare form of diabetes distinct from childhood-onset autoimmune diabetes mellitus type 1. It is characterized by insulin-requiring hyperglycemia that is diagnosed within the first months of life. Permanent neonatal diabetes requires lifelong therapy.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Transient neonatal diabetes mellitus 2
disease.description: Neonatal diabetes is a form of diabetes mellitus defined by the onset of mild-to-severe hyperglycemia within the first months of life. Transient neonatal diabetes remits early, with a possible relapse during adolescence.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the ABC transporter superfamily. ABCC family. Conjugate transporter (TC 3.A.1.208) subfamily.

comment.name: ABCMdb
comment.text: Database for mutations in ABC proteins

property.value: Autosomal dominant hyperinsulinism due to SUR1 deficiency
Autosomal recessive hyperinsulinism due to SUR1 deficiency
Diazoxide-resistant focal hyperinsulinism due to SUR1 deficiency
Defective ABCC8 can cause hypoglycemias and hyperglycemias
F:ATP-activated inward rectifier potassium channel activity
F:ATPase activity, coupled to transmembrane movement of substances
P:negative regulation of glial cell proliferation
P:positive regulation of maintenance of permeability of blood-brain barrier
P:positive regulation of tumor necrosis factor secretion
P:positive regulation of uterine smooth muscle relaxation
P:positive regulation of voltage-gated potassium channel activity

feature.description: In PNDM; compound heterozygous with R-1400; dbSNP:rs267606623.
In HHF1; altered intracellular trafficking; dbSNP:rs761749884.
In PNDM; with neurologic features; reduces the sensitivity of the K(ATP) channel to inhibition by MgATP; increases whole-cell K(ATP) current; dbSNP:rs80356637.
In HHF1; severe; high prevalence in Finland; loss of channel activity; dbSNP:rs137852672.
In PNDM; reduced inhibition by ATP.
In PNDM; compound heterozygous with D-263.
In PNDM; compound heterozygous with L-1523; highly reduced inhibition by ATP when associated with L-1523; dbSNP:rs768017509.
In PNDM; compound heterozygous with K-208; dbSNP:rs778892038.
In HHF1; no effect on cell membrane expression; no effect on traffic efficiency; dramatically reduced potassium channel response to activators such as MgADP or to diazoxide.
In HHF1; no effect on cell membrane expression; no effect on traffic efficiency; dramatically reduced potassium channel response to activators such as MgADP or to diazoxide.
In HHF1; no effect on cell membrane expression; no effect on traffic efficiency; reduced potassium channel response to activators such as MgADP or to diazoxide; dbSNP:rs761862121.
In HHF1; no effect on cell membrane expression; no effect on traffic efficiency; dramatically reduced potassium channel response to activators such as MgADP or to diazoxide.
In PNDM; slightly reduced inhibition by ATP; dbSNP:rs137852675.
In LIH; partially impairs ATP-dependent potassium channel function; dbSNP:rs28936370.
In HHF1; highly decreases cell membrane expression; highly reduced traffic efficiency; dramatically reduced potassium channel response to activators such as MgADP or to diazoxide.
In HHF1; does not alter surface expression but channels are not functional.
In HHF1; severe; high frequency in Ashkenazi Jewish patients; defective trafficking and lack of surface expression.
In HHF1; severe; loss of channel activity; dbSNP:rs769279368.
In HHF1 and PNDM; compound heterozygous with L-45 in PNDM; dbSNP:rs137852676.
In HHF1; modest impairment of channel function; dbSNP:rs28938469.
In HHF1; cannot form a functional channel, due to protein instability or defective transport to the membrane; dbSNP:rs387906407.
In HHF1; channels insensitive to metabolic inhibition and to activation by ADP; dbSNP:rs72559715.
In HHF1; no effect on cell membrane expression; no effect on traffic efficiency; dramatically reduced potassium channel response to activators such as MgADP or to diazoxide.
In HHF1; altered intracellular trafficking; dbSNP:rs28936371.
In HHF1; no effect on cell membrane expression; no effect on traffic efficiency; dramatically reduced potassium channel response to activators such as MgADP or to diazoxide.
In HHF1; mild; dominantly inherited; channels insensitive to metabolic inhibition and to activation by ADP; dbSNP:rs137852671.
In HHF1; no effect on cell membrane expression; no effect on traffic efficiency; dramatically reduced potassium channel response to activators such as MgADP or to diazoxide.
In PNDM; highly reduced inhibition by ATP when associated whith I-229.
In HHF1; reduced channels surface expression and response to ADP; dbSNP:rs72559713.
